messages.content: Ah OK so it would probably be 0 cost deal 3 damage enemy attacks you for 1 damage 2(3) times
I think an interesting idea is to attack yourself for 1 damage (scales with strength, vigor, wiz, etc) and deal 5x the damage to all enemies.
this is good, seven temp strength is a lot and it can be made permanent
its okay,  wiz did it better
idk if +3 str is worth the +1 energy cost

pretty great card in the context of gremlins. They have so many strong multi hit attacks and can create 10 shivs a turn easily, making this deal a ton of damage for 1 energy in basically any gremlin deck thats not based on shield.

This is a card you can just take in act 1 and its likely to work out well for you; thats pretty insane for a skill that does nothing by itself. This card sucks on snecko since its fundamentally weak. its just has such good synergy with the character its from
Ah yeah shivs yeah it's great just for that reason alone

I'm not really a huge fan of this card, but I am also on record as not liking flex very much with some way to remove debuffs (orange pellets) or runic pyramid to line the effect up better. Given that gremlins already have flex at common, and that you really want to have as much energy as possible to use the temporary strength on that turn, I find it pretty difficult to justify taking erupt over other rares or buying it a shop. Undeniably, the effect can be very powerful if you time it with some of gremlins very strong multihits, and can give you a massive turn if everything lines up properly, but gremlins don't have the kind of card manipulation effects to make that very reliable. I think the main reason to take erupt is having synergies with artifact or orange pellets to let you keep the strength, in which case it's like a massive inflame variant, which is great on a character with so many multihits. 

It's sort of competing with wiz as well as flex, and you can really stack wiz up quickly and easily in the right deck. Sure, wiz only applies on one attack, but the 10 "vigor" can easily be all you really need paired with cat scratch. Erupt is definitely preferable if you have a lot of shiv generation, but I think that in most fights the kind of explosive damage erupt provides can be obtained far easier with wiz and flex, and that those methods will solve everything but boss fights and giant head fairly well. I would really want runic pyramid to time this with my best strength multiplying cards before being happy with erupt. The upgrade is technically worse (or at least less efficient) than flex since you are paying 1 energy for the effect. If you can block the strength removal, strange spoon goes very well with this, though it's quite bad with shivs.

erupt works quite well with wiz. Consider that you can play 2 skills, then play erupt as the 3rd skill to active the damage bonus, giving you 15+ damage on your next attack. I use erupt the most with wizard. Flex needs an upgrade starting at a measly +2 strength, but erupt is viable right away even without an upgrade; which is why I think erupt is pickable in act 1 (who cares about nob, just one shot him 😎 )
for reference, the perfectly balanced <cat scratch> starts out dealing 36 damage for 1 energy; which skyrockets to 51 with a normal erupt

there even <flurry>   which when used with erupt might as well read as "kill the enemy"
